content.value: How to Get Help in Linux
The Linux help system provides built-in tools for learning commands, understanding options, and solving problems without the internet.
Use these tools to learn commands, explore features, and troubleshoot issues directly in the terminal.

value: Shows detailed manual pages for commands (full documentation).
Quick summary of options and usage (beginner-friendly).
Help for built-in shell commands (like cd, echo, exit).
Extended documentation with deeper technical details.
Displays a one-line summary of what a command does.

content.value: If you're stuck: try whatis → man → --help → help command (in that order).

content.description: Show the full manual page for ls (detailed information).
Quick help list of options and usage format.
Shows help information for shell built-ins like cd.
Open detailed documentation for Linux system utilities.
Shows a single-line explanation of what grep does.

items: Use ↑ ↓ or Page Up/Down to scroll
Press SPACE to jump page by page
Press Q to exit help pages
Use /word to search inside help pages

content.value: For quick learning: try man <command> and search using /keyword.

content.value: These skills form the foundation of Linux. With them, students can navigate, search, edit, fix permissions, and learn independently.
Don't try to memorize — focus on understanding when to use each command.
